review_text: studio is minutes stroll from here . that means we are regulars . we also visit numerous other locations for sustenance and refreshment ! said , this has become the firm food is great . chips are exceptionally addictive . fishcake & combo is beers are varied and many . well kept and flowing fresh lemonade on the bar and one of the most expertly crafted ’ s around ( without going over the top with sherry and basil leaves ) gets loud inside from in the surrounding offices . often calms swiftly before and staff are — very helpful and want a pub for a bit more of dinner than drinks ? upstairs and you have a dedicated dining room at the top of a spiral staircase . 's in all what a pub should be . . . by regulars and newbies alike . good food and seating outside , but plenty of people standing around in groups chatting and laughing over a good drink . ( and heating on one side for the evening glug ) 's a really good pub — in the centre of the creative industries hottest area , .

went to on , following a review from the and it was a very lovely discovery ! came with all my family and we loved the cosy . had a warm welcome from the waiter who found us a table directly ( we were ! ) loved our brunches , the plates are copious for less than . food is very tasty , really liked the quality of the products and especially the candy beetroots that never ate before and the cream in the salmon brunch . , we share french pain perdu which reminds me of the one ate when as a child ! that we start our sunday in a very good mood and we will do it again !

and bland fish and chips that in no way compare to other local establishments . would give the restaurant an average , but it 's hard to justify for just okay fish . the price is this high due to the bottomless chips but are bottomless chips really necessary ? beer selection and boring interior . smelled like fried fish when left . was fine and the food arrived in a reasonable timeframe . , there are just too many better options out there . or the .
great value here . piece of fish is big enough to share . staff - gave my grandson two freebie bottles of ginger beer on our last we 'd call a feed of fish n chips a ' , and accordingly is a great .
food and not expensive for london . staff was very . restaurant is suitable for children .

few away from square , found this restaurant by menu with a dark decor , bistrot style , small tables for , average service , well priced and % discount added to the bill for service charge , something common in had a charcuterie board as a starter , good selection with a fresh crisp salad , priced well at . main opted for a , cooked as per order . the meat is not amongst the best had , it is a good cut . asked the waiter for some bread , waited for minutes , waiter vanished so continued eating they forgot me , the bread never came , something that should have came as soon as asked for , since the plates were already delivered on the table . also took some minutes to ca n't say that this place is not good since the food quality is above average and well priced , however do expect a better service .

is a chain restaurant serving food for . 's not very authentic but it tastes fine , but would not recommend the . mains are all tasty , but not authentically . service is efficient , although we got brought the wrong dish twice , it was quickly rectified . are much better independent restaurants nearby .

is a traditional pub with an upstairs dining was fairly busy and the atmosphere was relaxed . menu was varied , with a small selection of starters and a wider variety of mains including a chicken roast . ordered starters to share amongst people and none of them mains were superb . and pie was one of the best 've ever had , and the portions were generous . vegetables were particularly good , something often find wanting in a pub lunch , but not here , and no doubt helped by having next staff were friendly and attentive and the meal was reasonably priced . 'd recommend the for a : you do n't have a big appetite , considering sharing or even skipping a starter as we found the mains generous and difficult to finish .

steaks were amazing and how the menu is explained is interesting . you 're not a steak fan then be prepared for a more limited menu but if you are a steak fan , you wo n't be disappointed . we were eating at peak time on a evening it 's not surprising it was busy , the service started off very efficient but things did slow down as they got busier . risk of sounding old , it 's quite dark and very loud in there so not overly romantic but there 's definitely a good atmosphere . food is quite expensive although it is worth it , it 's more of an occasional thing though rather than somewhere 'd go regularly .

me start by saying the prices are ridiculous anyway . for a main course of veal schnitzel is not appropriate outside of a michelin starred restaurant ( as good as the schnitzel was , and it was really good ) . the worst thing was , when we asked for chips instead of new potatoes with our schnitzel they gave us two chips . . think for a main that really takes the dessert was good ( had the mousse ) but a little odd tasting ( it came with pretzels which did n't really go ) and the service was ok , if not outstanding . waitress was pleasant but there was a wait for our desserts , and at times we had to work to catch waiting staff 's attention . they were not really deserving of the full % added service charge . 'd go again , but only to the bar area downstairs which for some reason is cheaper ( but still not exactly cheap ) . only if there were n't other better options available nearby .
long climb to the top of 's dome , is a welcomed respite . nice sandwiches , salads , and soup . is a chain , and can be found at many locations around . a good choice .
had a private function on day lunch . food was outstanding along with the service . defo visit again . you for the hospitality .

decor and easily seated although this was on a did n't taste of anything . could n't decide on the pasta so had a half and half dish which is a good idea . spaghetti with king prawns which asked for spicy which was ok but felt was lacking flavour , garlic , basil , and the spaghetti with lobster , which also lacked flavour and the lobster was n't great . husband had the penne which he has at every italian restaurant , which he said the server did n't really seem bothered , just said she would pass my comments on to the kitchen . .

visit today - this time adults ( needing gluten free food ) and children . checked they had food and we were handed a and childrens ' menus when we were seated . waitress sat at the childrens ' ( and ) level to ask the children what they would like and also made sure that she checked with before wring the order down . menu was extensive enough and and the food was , as always very good . visitors coming next month will be back ! !

by a local , tried this pub and it turned to be a very good tip . large selection of beers and drinks , and the menu will appeal to everybody . tried the burger and it was special . good in the size n the taste . the only little downside - a bit pricey , but you get the quality . they have also little beer garden at the back , so you can enjoy both worlds .

arrived at about on a for some lunch before an afternoon tour we had booked . this time we got a table on the main floor but those arriving at or after had to go barmaid was really friendly . ordered two different burgers - mine said the salad and pickle ' on the menu so asked her whether that meant ( as suspected ) that it came without these things . said not and that it was just the menu being a bit quirky , so ordered it it came without ! my boyfriends came with them and he does n't like them , so got them anyway in the end ! food was delicious and reasonably priced for central ( burger and fries around the mark ) atmosphere was relaxed , service good ( apart from small pickle issue ! ) and would highly recommend it . change from the chains .
staff friendly service great atmosphere great food , and great offers , meal , test card , gourmet card , times card , , they do all the discount

was our first time in , and wanted to make the most of it by hitting some cool spots . being extremely disappointed with 's we were n't sure what to expect from entering , we were both blown away by the dining room . husband started with the crab salad and had the lamb breast – both outstanding . server ( believe his name was ) recommended the pork chop ( cooked perfectly with a nice bit of char ) and the sea bass ( also cooked perfectly with a nice crisp skin but the accompanying sauce was bit on the sweet side ) . were thoroughly satisfied with our meal but were too full for dessert so we asked if we could move to the bar for some cocktails . was very accommodating and had us seated right away . even came by later on to make sure were enjoying ourselves . husband and are always in search of a good cocktail . had just gone to & and the , both known for their cocktails . can honestly say is on par with both of those establishments . drinks were great ! each had three cocktails from the bar menu and would have stayed for more if we didn ’ t have a flight to to catch the next dining experience was a great way to cap off a first time visit to an amazing city ! were a local , would definitely be a regular at . will definitely be back one day ! !

visited on a around , so it was busy as expected though not packed . was constantly getting bumped and nudged by staff and customers squeezing through the narrow channel between my chair and the chair of the lady behind me . really conducive to a relaxing had a as a shared starter , which was nice enough . mains and drinks took a long time to arrive . burgers were thick but a bit dry . asked our waiter for ketchup but it never so we gave up waiting . the plus side , my cocktail was they were busy hence the slow service and forgetfulness , but did n't enjoy dinner that much . 'd recommend coming during a quieter period .

do n't usually leave restaurant reviews , however , this was one of the worst eating out experiences have ever had and have eaten in went here on a evening with friends to celebrate a special occasion . chose this restaurant because it was a nice , warm evening and the outside space looked appealing . were seated outside within minutes which was good and given menu 's . when we ordered our drinks we were easily waiting minutes , despite reminding our waiter numerous times ( who could barely speak ) . this time our food had come and bearing in mind this is an , we asked for some as it was not offered to us with our pizza and pastas , and were then waiting an incredibly long time for food was going cold and one of my friends had to keep getting up and finding someone to ask where our drinks and parmesan were as we wanted to enjoy these with our meal ! am more than happy to wait a reasonable time for drinks etc but this was just taking the mick ! ! ! ! was not an enjoyable experience at all . top it off a few hours later woke up at with really painful stomach cramps to then have to rush to the toilet with awful & . have been sick about times in my whole life and am not a sick person so this really says it all about this restaurant ! ! ! ! must have been my pasta because there is no other logical reason . two friends were ok who had different meals to me , and have to say the pizza 's and pastas are cheap at . we had an exceptionally bad experience but we wo n't be attending again .

visit every summer , sometimes for a week or two , but mostly for the entire summer . is one restaurant return to over and over . the oldest restaurant in gives it a long history . food , ambiance and service are wonderful here . ca n't imagine a stop in without eating , have no hesitation in recommending it to others or returning again and again in the future . place oozes with character and flair .

found the whilst staying overnight nearby . excellent find . is a small genuine family run trattoria with a great atmosphere . was very full when arrived but was found a table immediately . is an incredibly extensive menu of traditional antipasti , pasta , pizza , fish , veal and chicken dishes , all of which are very reasonably priced , particularly for . is available by the bottle or half bottle and house wine is sold by the glass , half litre or litre , again very reasonably priced . friendly family have been running this trattoria for over years and it obviously has a regular clientele . represents excellent value for money . will certainly be eating here again next time am staying in this area of .

spot for fish and chips , right near station . give you unlimited chips . few times have visited , it has n't been overly crowded . staff is very friendly and it 's in a safe area . really like this spot for a consistent fish and chips experience

just love everything about this restaurant and it never disappoints . service from as always and , the food is delicious , beautifully presented , and all in a lovely setting . wife said the soufflé was the finest dessert she has ever value for money , undoubtably my favourite restaurant . visit wo n't be too far away .

spoke to someone to book a table for afternoon not knowing they did not usually open on until later but was told it would be ok they would open earlier for us . was people we all had various dishes the portions were large everyone enjoyed their meal . staff were very friendly the service very good we would definitely go back .

of us ordered the set course menu which included a glass of . cost was about . good menu is limited to say the least . choices for each course , but pay your money portions were smallish but well cooked and presented . had slices of bread , so to avoid a fight , asked for more , which came without any bistro itself is welcoming and is a classic bistro was full at lunchtime and there was a nice buzz about the value .

that this restaurant was associated with another in only afterward but is probably even better than its sister version because it is or appears to be new . all had different pizzas with one of us having grilled fish and all meals were eaten with pleasure since each was well presented and cooked . staff makes for a pleasant experience and of course being able to see the chefs working away and appearing to enjoy being there shows that there is a decent spirit in the place and this is reflected in the reasonable price also for what we had and will go again

of us came to have late lunch ; we chose the course set menu . the odd hour to be eating lunch ( ) , everything was fresh and delicious . generous caesar salad , with plenty of and fresh anchovies , a smooth and minty pea soup , and a very good fish pie , aromatic with wine , 'm sure , and generous amounts of fish inside . prawns , noticed , but perhaps that was this specific recipe . for two courses it was n't cheap ( vegetables extra ) but good quality .

lovely meal sitting outside in the sun with lots going on . service even though they were very busy . think that the pizze served at are the best outside of and especially the romana pesto pomodoro with my own extra topping of gorgonzola . made even better as the meal was paid for using of vouchers which with turned into of tokens . only slight downside to sitting outside was a slight smell of drains

stumbled upon during a recent stay in . chose them because they were the only restaurant that was crowded with diners . were not disappointed and had a wonderful meal with excellent service . lamb dishes are terrific . had the ' for two and all of the assorted dishes were excellent . nice atmosphere , too . enjoyed so much that we returned the next night for dinner as well .

is a great little , trendy restaurant for a casual and fun meal or few glasses of wine . in the heart of it 's a great spot for a date or a catch up . take what you want from plates and pay for the number of plates you have at the end . 's a really relaxed place with very friendly and laid back staff . and desserts are very tasty and wines are do a great early bird menu ( or an inbetween lunch and dinnertime menu would be more accurate ) which is nice to have with top quality you have an evening or afternoon wandering around , or dials you wo n't have a bad meal here . only advice 'd give is if there 's only a few of any type of dish no the counter they might be there a little while so might be cold so go for something else and grab your first choice when the next batch comes out !
, you need to train your staff and get a decent restaurant manager . minutes without the slightest acknowledgement is not a good experience !
a wonderful cafe , fantastic coffee and historic sour dough toast with home made jam and marmalade . value too , lovely friendly staff , does n't get much better . recommended .

love my food and have eaten at many restaurants up and down the country but can honestly say , delivers the best quality food time and time again . portion sizes are excellent , the taste of the food amazing and the service is excellent . have to say , have never ever had a chicken tikka so good , it 's juicy and tender and just melts in your mouth . is my benchmark dish and has never been beaten anywhere else in the . 's excellent value for money and can confirm you get a complimentary liqueur at the end of your meal . 's a very nice restaurant , cosy and welcoming . ca n't recommend it highly enough .

have long been a fan of the afternoon tea and this is an opportunity for restaurants to shine offering small bite size scones with finger sandwiches and buckets of tea to wash it do so many restaurants get it wrong ? is a fab location and should be packed out for afternoon tea , it was not , there was just one other table . we were told to sit where we liked and we did not see anyone again until they brought the tea ? they had might have ordered a glass of was just choices of sandwich ham & mustard or ( no vegetarian option was offered ) scones and cakes were all shop bought and the scones were far to big for afternoon tea . there was a defrosted mini eclair and millionaire shortbread plus a huge slice of sandwich which also appeared shop was a very average day and like something a bit special for afternoon tea .
a very busy time of the day ( before an athletics meet at the ) we were seated , ordered and served very quickly , the food was lovely , not sure about sharing a table though !

is a place one should not miss while visiting . a delightful shopping and discovery tour , the restaurant is suitably located to have your meal . may have to queue a minute during peak hours , but it is worthwhile . garlic mushroom is commendable and beans on toast or “ posh beans ” as on the menu - if remember correctly - cater for those who like spicy food ! son enjoyed his cloudy lemonade . draught beer had a different aftertaste unlike what am familiar with . an enjoyable experience , reasonably priced , tasty food , prompt and friendly service which made us return the following day even managed to get the same table ! !

really like the setting of the restaurant and the staff we friendly and had the superfood salad , it was ok , but it was very small . ordered chicken with the salad and expected chicken breast , but instead got a tiny amount of dark chicken meat . would try the again , but would n't order the salad again .

started to rain on our day trip so called in . a sharing platter which was fairly tasty though overpriced . comfy and a good selection of beers on tap . waiting for our food waitresses kept taking our plates away which was quite funny . would say it was above average as atmosphere good and food nice enough quality .

wanted quick food and went to friday 's . of us got seated immediately and we enjoyed our food and were good , fries a bit so and so . mate had the chicken and shrimp , tasted good but was heavily overpriced at about £ for shrimp and a little piece of with mash and was really good and and would def return if wanted food with beer and .

my partner went with friends on the opening week , she recommended that we go one evening to unwind after work . atmosphere was wonderful , and the service was excellent . was explained to us , from the concept of the food , to the tailored cocktails and the ethos behind the style of the restaurant . food was exemplary ; the yogurt puri were a delight - so much so we ordered another helping , and the puffed rice was inviting , fresh , and with the perfect mix of flavour and heat . a stand out was the chilli paneer , and the kati roll ; both of which would happily eat again , and attempted to steal from my partner 's plate ! of note were the selection of drinks ( though being a school night , we stuck to and shared a cocktail ) - the fact that the cocktail was clearly made with an on the spot sugar water mix , rather than a pre-made glucose `` simply syrup '' speaks volumes ; they care deeply about the food , the drink , and the experience , and seem to want to serve the food that you 'd want to make for yourself - there 's no . one of the best meals 've eaten this year , and we 're taking friends from out of town tonight for another round !

here on impulse as could n't find the original restaurant that we wanted to go to ! ! pork bun starter was good and my ban lee vegetable salad with grilled chicken was lovely with all the vegetables love such as avocado , butternut squash , broccoli etc and the portion size was really surprising as was actually full after had chicken phad which he thought was nice but has had a cocktail which wa one of the nicest 've ever tried . was slow but this is what prefer as hate being rushed when eating . was clean and toilets were nicely decorated , all things that find important when dining . n't realise this was a chain but 'd definitely return if in the area again or near another branch .

lunch today with a friend . both had a salad with a bottle of sparkling water . well presented and very tasty . followed the salad with some lovely chocolate cake and a custard tart between us . seemed too good an opportunity to miss . bill was reasonable seeing that we were near . service was excellent . only slightly odd thing was having to leave the building to go down a flight of steps to find the toilets .

for a quick and unsophisticated meal at a very good price . advantage of the meal deal of two courses for just over and thoroughly enjoyed quality of the food and service is inconsistent and depends greatly on how busy they are . said that if you are unsatisfied tell the staff and they will endeavour to sort out the issues quickly .

place is a real find . visited night for dinner , and the staff are just fantastic - super friendly and really helpful . asked at the last minute whether we could sit in the downstairs bar rather than the upstairs restaurant . acquaintance had said the restaurant part could sometimes be a bit empty and lacking in atmosphere . had put a note against our booking and offered us a table downstairs , although we then ended up eating upstairs as it was really busy ! was too much trouble . lovely waiters were very knowledgeable , which is not a given at many places . was delicious , the wine was excellent and a good selection of reasonably priced bottles available . had a fantastic time and will certainly be back .

a nice day it ’ s a good place for a few beers outside while you munch on one of those chorizo burgers , ! ! ! friendly and a little crowded in the summer but it all adds to the cask ales and nice ’ t try the food here but why would you when you can eat at .

a few things put us off before we even arrived . for a credit card to secure for an early dining time on a evening with a no-show cancellation charge of per person . told we only had the table for hours ( a real of mine these days ) . email confirmation on the day to confirm also mentioned that each diner would have to order courses . ? nothing confirmed this on the menu and would have liked to see them argue the toss with my dining companions given two are barristers and the other is a our early dining time only other tables were occupied . were good and average price for location . water was brought when asked but not refilled , unlike the wine . was very tasty and good quality but it would need to be for the price . was quite a push on ordering sides with the mains too . side of couscous will easily feed to the uncomfortable seating and the end of our hour slot looming , we took them up on their suggestion from the email that we could continue with our desserts and coffee at next door . we were asked to settle the bill before moving next to compare the café prices to the restaurant ( nearly half ) . the café serves mezze so would expect portion sizes to be smaller . to say we wo n't be going back to check . friend thought she might have shisha until pointed out the price .

went to for our office lunch . service was really slow and it took us over hours to have our meal . waited over minutes for our dessert and watched a waiter serve and be attentive to every table around us but we were ignored . were going to order more cocktails but gave up due to this . only good thing was that a waitress recognised we 'd waited too long for dessert and took the bottles of wine we 'd had off our bill !

title about sums it up . ham hock terrine was a bit bland , the mushroom starter looked more appetising . pork belly was decent and reports are the cod was tasty too . do a menu with and our friendly waiter did not skimp on this . views of course . and the friendly service , and the banter with the other guests , wrapped up this one as a great little package . foursome really enjoyed ourselves . 'd recommend taking new visitors to here . 's an experience and gives you a little bit of everything .

here for breakfast on an unseasonably cold morning . the unlimited coffee and price tag looked inviting the food was just ok and the place too busy for the four of us to be served together and coffee refills came but very slowly . staff were very pleasant and hard working but the place is just a little too tight for them to move around easily .

did n't know what to expect having breakfast at a prison , but it was absolutely amazing ! both had the eggs benedict and both decided it was by far the best eggs benedict that we 've ever had ! ( our server ) was lovely , personable and attentive . what made it even more special was the fact that you ca n't bring cell phones into the restaurant so you actually enjoyed conversations with one another . were concerned about getting there , but a quick minute ride on the tube and stops on the bus ( picked up right outside the tube station ) made it a minutes travel time from central . will definitely be back for lunch at the next time we 're in

n't personally eat there but had a browse through the menu ! very fancy and definitely worth very steep prices for both drinks and food , but guess that 's what you pay for with the absolutely amazing view ! a busy place , was all reserved since today ! ( ) if ever have the chance and money , will visit again !

have been there the first time and we liked it quite a lot . staff was really friendly , especially our waiter was great ! decoration was `` very '' so we liked it a food was really good and we can not complain about a thing , maybe only that the portions are a little small . the crumble was awesome and that was really a big portion ! for eating at the oldest restaurant would recommend it , if you like the more hearty stuff and things like venison or guinea fowl . pies are good as well !
crab salad , crisp viognier . big portions though , fine for little appetites : ) was still hungry after lunch , service and beautiful environment
had was wonderful but the hand roll mediocre - not filled fully like other places . wife had ramen with prawn - which was delicious but not enough . friends sushi looked delicious .

to a lot of bottomless brunches in and can honestly say this is the best . service , actually delicious food ( and a decent amount of it ) and a choice of drinks that you can mix throughout the meal . the drinks flow steadily through the sitting which is exactly meets the brief for a bottomless brunch !

on board at the end of , a beautiful , warm sunny bank holiday , and we visited with a pre-booked wowcher ; arrived earlier than our allotted time , as the stroll through to get to the embankment where the boat is moored took less time than we had anticipated ( maybe because it was bank holiday monday , and everywhere was deserted ) ; hubby boarded the ship to check if we would be allowed to eat earlier than our booking time , and emerged to tell me it would be was a small steep ramp to get to the gangway , which was wide enough to fit my wheelchair on , and then a downward incline to get to the boat itself , although a kind assistant offered to help my husband , he did manage . at the boat a slight step to get in and then a flight of stairs to the restaurant ; as i can hubby assisted me and the kindly assistant carried my wheelchair up for were seated at a nice table at the side of the boat offering lovely views out onto the , and had our menu explained - our voucher entitled us to courses , starter or dessert with main , plus a glass of prosecco ( and a boat ride on a sightseeing cruise ) . menu was quite small in way of choice ( on the table menu at least ) but we both found enough variety , even though we both chose the same starter and mains . didnt have to wait too long for our starters , we chose the duck , served warm , perfect combination of crisp skin and pinkish meat , along with a slice of garlic bread and raspberry coulis , it was a perfect mains , along with a lovely crisp light prosecco , were served with just the right amount of time between - again we both chose the same , chicken , served with carrot puree , carrots , peas and rainbow chard , again all done perfectly and added some extra drinks - a cocktail for me ( pier ? ) a long drink , very , but at a time , a tad too expensive , a pint for hubby and at wasnt too bad , and a litre of water at for a bottle , slightly cheaper than most places in the also decided , as we were so enjoying our time their and the view , that we would buy desserts - chose their take on an eton mess sort of thing which has huge , but delicious , hubby took creme brulee served with a crumbly shortbread biscuit ; both were very nice , but the starters took the edge over the desserts unusually . sponge in the mess thing however was spent a very enjoyable few hours there , and could have easily stayed for the evening , drinking wine on the outer deck , however we had places to be , so las had to leaving we checked out the loo 's ; no adapted loo , but the ladies were on the same deck as the restaurant , and the door enabled the wheelchair to be pushed to it , but not suitable if you can not get out of your chair and walk a few the boat posed an additional challenge - we were now at low tide , so the gangway was at an impossibly high slope ; again staff came to help , but it did pose a challenge . , if you need access maybe check tide tables and go to in all , staff were brilliant , helpful and very chatty , food was excellent and very tasty , the boat trip can be used untill the winter , so extra useful , and the wowcher was excellent value . would definitely return !
seen a previous review entitled ' ' . - not for me . was n't bad - just unimaginative , tasteless base and undercooked . enough service . for the pizza and glasses of mineral water .
brothers are killing it ! rarely come to without dropping by for a burger - should do the same ! stuff .

placed restaurant that can be found in a side street between and cut above any fast equivalents , and a place where burgers and output are treated with respect and priced visited at a quiet time on a afternoon ; just us and two other groups in residence . a big place - there 's a versatile bar at one end of the room which is from the restaurant which itself is side on to a small open kitchen . dark and basic inside , but lightened by a full length plate glass window . had the prime spot overlooking the not very interesting street with a dull view of the rear end of an office compact menu is very appealing for those of a carnivorous nature , and certainly would have been more bullish with my selection had it not been lunchtime . it was , went for the pulled pork which arrived in a small pan accompanied by a little of excellent french fries flavoured with rosemary , a tiny pot of tasty sauce and some coleslaw , all presented on a board . n't say that the pulled pork conveyed much evidence of having been smoked in hickory for hours ( as indicated on the menu ) , but it was all serviceable shredded meat , and the sauce did perk it up a bit . colleague 's lamb and feta burger looked more the part ; meaty and firm , although the accompanying yogurt sauce did n't really zing it up very much . , neither us left really the place for an expansive wine list but the abbreviated choice gave focus , and our robust reds did the were ably looked after by the efficient girl who greeted us at the bar when we arrived . manager was also very amiable whilst we were sorting out the a visit , and my tip would be to not go for the soft option but try something big and meaty with all the traditional sides .

know what you get when you walk in here and its exactlly as you expect . , burgers , steaks etc . had a very nice steak for around . really good value for money . wasn ; t especially busy but service was quite slow . this is the type uf resteraunt you 're after would recommend . a bet ' .

give some background to this review , am a huge fan of , have all of his books , follow his shows ( except the ones on the sink estates ) and in fact have cooked hundreds of his recipes over the years ( successfully might add ) and 'm a big supporter of the way he tries to educate us to be brave and experiment with food . the way cook and wo n't ( normally ) hear a bad word said about the guy ! now that is . were in to see a show and wandered around and planned to eat before heading to the and had a place in mind that we had been to before . on seeing the menu on the wall of this restaurant with 's name emblazoned on the menu we went in absolutely positive we were in safe hands . restaurant looks trendy , the staff were friendly , polite and there were lots of them , despite only a small handful of customers . 's not like me to venture into any restaurant without checking first , and our experience here reminds me why . was a very cold night and it looked inviting with wall heaters and plenty ( almost all ) tables free . could possibly go wrong ? the starters available did not inspire us to choose any ( disappointed straight away ) so we went straight for mains , we had not noticed the lack of appealing starters before we headed into the restaurant and were seated ready to order . we both ordered mains of pizza described as `` pulled slow roasted pork , apple sauce and with pork crackling '' . sounded different . what arrived was virtually tasteless . small amount of pork that was there tasted nice but the rest of the pizza was bland beyond belief . was also covered with a huge amount of water cress . very trendy but there is only so much watercress a pizza can take ! would have added flavour as well as colour . cress added only colour and attempted to cover the fact that there was little topping underneath . have added pics and do n't be fooled into thinking there is a good amount of pork on the pizza , what you can see is mainly crackling . ordering the pizza we looked for a nice dessert to order after the main but the choice was awful . ' roll , blueberry tart , black forest gateaux or cheese and biscuits or ice cream . get that they are trying to rejuvenate the food from the seventies but the very few choices left me uninspired . publicity wrongly states their pizzas are `` universally loved ! '' beg to differ . also states they aim to take us on a `` journey of discovery through and reintroduce us to familiar flavours '' are so many fabulous innovative dishes available today it seems odd and just wrong on every level to want to bring back something that went out of favour because better choices came along ? makes me shudder to think the tourists coming here will leave thinking this is what our top chefs are capable of . was a cold evening , there were heated seats and overhead heaters but we were still chilly sitting there so the thought of a cold dessert ? we left without dessert and went instead to a nice coffee bar near the theatre and had a fabulous dessert . can not understand how this wonderful chef can allow this food to be cooked in his name . he got too big and too famous to have time to care ? sincerely hope not but the evidence is that despite bad reviews on here he is not listening . is not the only bad review on here , had read the reviews on here before walking in we would have gone elsewhere . is important what paying customers think . accepting they are subjective , turning a blind eye regardless is a mistake . is a fabulous location and yes it 's probably mainly tourists who are the target market but please let them leave with a great impression of food and not underwhelmed as we were . some of the fabulous recipes from his books would be more impressive there 's no shortage of inspirational recipes available . work well and taste delicious , sadly ca n't say the same about the food on offer here . have to speak as find and am sad to say your venture is a huge let down .

would like to make you aware of a situation which occurred on while we were enjoying ’ s ’ s . went downstair to use the restroom . male employees exited the restroom just as was about to enter . in , discovered a very soiled pair of men ’ s underwear sitting next to the sink . used a towel and disposed of them in the trash can . threw the underwear in the trash , a house keeper entered and explained to her what saw . that point asked to speak with a manager . returned to my table feeling nauseated and was unable to continue with my tea . waited approximately minutes and no manager approached us , so sought out the hostess to find him . found him and explained to him what happened . apologized but offered no recovery stating that the restaurant could not be held responsible as it was a public facility . then sought out the next in command from the hotel ’ s front desk . assistant general manager spoke with me and reaffirmed what the manager had stated : are not responsible and therefore can offer no recovery . assistant general manager also informed me that he had seen the problem prior to my coming upon it and had sent housekeeping to clean it up . me , this information added an entirely new dimension to the situation . fact that he knew about it and had not taken steps to lock off the lavatory while waiting for it to be cleaned , thereby preventing anyone else from seeing it , was inexcusable . have been the hotel business with for years and am very surprised as to the manner in which the management of a hotel of this calibre handled the situation . @

's certainly not the kind of place that would advise for a romantic evening or celebration , the atmosphere is n't good ! in all , would not recommend that people go here if they want to be treated with respect or if they want to enjoy an evening . the time we were leaving , could n't wait to go . just found it

off you need to read this in the context that the below happened at the 's `` pop up '' at the where they operated a bar and restaurant in for ten days rather than in their established base on . , this review is really more relevant if you plan to visit their `` pop up '' in or elsewhere rather than the we arrived we were told that the restaurant was booked out and we were shown to the bar . setting was lovely ( it was in , ) ordered a couple of items ( cold plates ) from the bar menu and some drinks arrived and we fell into chatting . twenty minutes or so there was still no sign of our food ( and in fact over the following ten minutes we became increasingly aware that there was also no sign of our waiter ) , about thirty five minutes after ordering the food we managed to get the attention of a passing staff member who said he would investigate . returned to say that unfortunately the delay would continue and that even the bowl of olives we had ordered would take a further ten minutes to that point it hardly seemed worth it , and clearly they did n't feel the need to expedite our order , so told him that we might as well just pay for the drinks and clearly mistakes happen , and the staff member we spoke to was reasonably polite and 'm sure it was uncomfortable for him to have to get involved , felt that we had received poor service on two fronts : , the management could have made an effort to expedite our order once they discovered their mistake ( about it : how long do you think it would take to decant some olives into a bowl and bring it to the table ? minutes ? ) , given the fact that we had clearly received poor service and had not received most of what we ordered , it left a bitter taste in the mouth to be presented with the bill including an amount for what they termed `` discretionary service '' , all in all , it was a lovely setting but their management , systems and processes probably are n't up to expanding out of their familiar base in .

booked for myself and my husband to see in the of . had researched a number of options but the location of the was second to none . was n't the cheapest night out but we knew what the prices were for other locations nearby and it seemed good value given location and what was on offer . evening surpassed our expectations by a considerable margin ! ! knew the location would be wonderful but the boat was decorated in a very classy way , there was loads of space between tables so you felt like you were having a very private meal ( had expected it to be packed to the rafters ! ) and the staff were attentive . entertainment throughout dinner ( a pianist and then a singer ) were also brilliant and a good warm up for later ! food was good - nice , well thought out blend of courses and good for a large event where everything was served together . was n't star food - but let 's be fair - you 're paying for location , not the gourmet event of a lifetime ! had also expected the alcohol prices to be exorbitant given that they had a captive audience . , we were more than pleasantly surprised - nothing eye watering and very sensible pricing that meant we felt we could really enjoy the drinks and have what we wanted rather than nurse them whilst waiting for our champers that was included at midnight ! view from the deck at midnight was simply spectacular . taking fireworks , directly in front of you . can not do it justice if you love , as we do ! girls even brought our fizz out to us in the pouring rain as we 'd left our table to head outside early ! midnight we danced until the early hours and then headed home after the initial ' had already passed through the tube . one of the best nights out of my life . are already priming ourselves to book for next year !

have often driven past and noticed that it always seems to be busy , so today we stopped by for lunch . place is nothing much to look at inside or outside - it is basically a converted pub perched on the end of a terrace of houses . once the food comes , what a great surprise . is a very wide choice of tapas dishes , and a comprehensive list of mains . mixed the two . had smoked salmon followed by omelette - both excellent - and the rather more discerning had artichokes in vinaigrette and a crab , prawn and avocado salad , both of which she pronounced very fresh and more than somewhat superlative ! is a good wine list , with many by the glass , very fairly priced . chose one of several roses on offer . note that some posters have complained at the attitude of some of the waiters and it is true that on the surface they did not seem the friendliest souls , but we put this down to ( a ) the language barrier and ( b ) being rushed off their feet . lot of the customers were themselves , which must be a good sign that is getting something right , and there was a fair smattering of locals , too . recognised as a very high ranking editor on an important daily newspaper ; another was a senior civil servant who has been much in the news lately . on one of the occasions we drove past , saw an supermodel sitting outside . , alright , you 've forced her name out of me : it was . is good enough for them , it is certainly good enough for us . will be back , next time for dinner when we will be hungrier and hopefully more adventurous with our choice of dishes .

wellbeing cafe - all dishes offer a pleasant surprise in terms of flavour combinations . vegan options available . brunch plates are reasonably priced and good quality albeit with some options you may still be hungry ! smoothies are very tasty but too expensive making the bill pretty pricey . the smoothies were a little more affordable this place would be a great gem for a healthy brunch .

decided to try here on a busy night , you can get an idea of what the food looks like as the restaurant is surrounded by large glass panels , we had decided that we wanted a pizza and they looked great as we stood at other diners , they must have felt like they were in a zoo lol ( sorry if you were one of the diners ) it was bitterly cold and as this place is outside we were a little worried that we may freeze to death while eating , no need for any concerns there , as they have large electric heaters on the walls opposite your table , like the ones you get on pub table umbrellas , and they have customer controls on the wall behind you to heat the seat and underneath for your feet , in fact my wife had to take her coat off , our orders where taken quickly and our waiter suggested we have a portion of skinny fries to munch on while we waited for our pizzas , which was a great idea , and they were lovely , now to the pizzas , ordered the pulled pork with chorizo and chilli , the base was heaven as was most of the other ingredients , but suppose you would want it to be great at around , the only problem was it was n't pulled pork it was just fat and gristle , only ate about slices , the waiter came to take the plates and pointed out that could n't eat it as it was just fat , he informed me it was belly pork , well if it is then label it as that not pulled pork ? , anyway fully intended to pay for it but when he arrived with the bill he said he had taken it off , so fair play to him , my wife just had the margarita pizza , but did n't like the fresh tomatoes , philistine ha ha , anyway the bill came to around with a few drinks , so not to bad in as the average price of a pint is , the people from on the table next to us had the fish and chips and declared it a winner , another plus was the fact that it is quite a small place so to have around staff serving and cooking is very good , that is without the staff underneath the restaurant as there was a dumb waiter , all in all we enjoyed our experience and will give it another try on our next visit , thanked the waiter for removing the price of my pizza from the bill and left a descent tip , thanks guys ,

had high hopes of this place especially as it is often given rave reviews by its customers . my experience was underwhelming . should have read the late review of the place which understand was not flattering whole ambience is of a bistro than an upmarket restaurant - although the the individually folded disposable cotton hand towels in the loos might suggest otherwise . arrived around , to be greeted on opening the door , by a cramped lobby and a steep staircase . left we entered the restaurant and were greeted by someone witht who had understanding to my my mind was not a good start to the evening . were promptly shown to our table which was located against the wall , where the seating space was very cramped . be fair all the tables seemed to be like this ] . seats themselves were basically old bistro style wooden chairs with no arms and were very uncomfortable . small table was also rickety and unstable . were white linen cloths but no flowers or candles . decor of the room itself was a watered down attempt at art , the only notable features being a couple of mirrors attached to some pillars and the dark coloured woodwork . was , but despite the pretty [ some might say tacky ] lights outside , inside the decor was definitely from the scrooge school of art , with the only minimalist decorative feature being a plastic garland which looked like it had been bought at a local store . were no pretty lights , no stars , no candles , no frosted grapes or fruit , no holly , no ivy , no flowers - nada - just one plastic garland draped over at the back of the room . assume this lack of festive decoration was either due to the fact the restaurant is always fully booked , so they feel there is need to bother , or because it regards itself an establishment primarily for the educated `` foodie '' who can be expected to have little interest such tacky things as decor or indeed the visual presentation of the restaurant more generally . perhaps be fair once the restaurant filled up it did n't lack atmosphere , this being provided by the noise and general hubbub of its clientele some of whom seemed to consist people who would like to live near but could not afford to or who perhaps did live in but were tired of their local restaurant choice , and had for the evening to see what a trip out to a starred restaurant bistro near would be like . by the the fact the restaurant was full on a evening they either had had a previously better experience than , or they were inclined to rely too heavily on the views of `` experts '' . service however was good : unpretentious , and swift the waiters seemed to glide effortlessly about the place despite the cramped nature of the establishment . only complaint was that found could not easily understand the accent of our softly spoken server . were presented with a very extensive [ if pricey ] wine list which am sure compares well with other establishments of this quality . as we were driving , only chose a small glass of merlot - this was pleasant but nothing special . partner had a glass of fresh orange juice . [ came with a lump ice despite him not asking for it ] menu here is in style and offers a table experience which was priced at per person [ rather more than expected from their website which suggested a lower price ] . matter , there was a fair choice of dishes and an extensive wine menu . both chose the same dishes am not sure why starter of fish cakes in a creamy chunky soup was well presented and was simply superb . first class . it was all down hill from there . our main course we chose a steak which came with with chunky chips [ this dish was extra per head ] . was , as would be expected for fillet streak and very tender was cooked carefully to our choice , and was well presented on the plate - but the flavour ? a completely different story . my mind it was bland and complete lacking in flavour , [ as was the accompanying jus ] . this was an off day but one wonders why a restaurant of this quality is offering this expensive cut of meat [ which to my mind does n't compare well the flavour of a good ribeye steak ] instead of less less expensive cuts which are known known to have a better flavour . perhaps suggests that the chef here needs to be more discriminating and place greater weight on the flavour of the meat and rather less on a the fancy name of this quite frankly over rated cut . was n't bad , but just was n't good value for money [ remember we paid extra } and it was lacking in flavour . accompanying chips were the saving grace , being both crisp and having an excellent flavour . the meat should have been the star and it was n't - it was just bland . desert was baked . consisted of a grapefruit sorbet covered in meringue accompanied by an assortment of fresh fruit salad . sorbet itself was well flavoured , if perhaps a little tart [ but then again grapefruit is ] , unfortunately it was ruined by the meringue which looked rather prissy being piped with tiny stars it had a curious elastic consistency and an odd and almost unpleasant taste which could n't exactly nail down - however more notably it lacked the requisite sweetness to offset the tart sorbet . for presentation , the dish looked like an individual lemon meringue pie might have bought at or the & frozen food counter . thought it a disappointment despite the elaborate description on the menu . not possessed a star , been somewhat less expensive and less cramped , i might have rated it as four stars the but given the lack of space and comfort , the rickety tables , the unspectacular food and the poor value for money could n't . [ bill came to over for two , even though we only had one small glass of merlot wine and single glass of orange juice and no coffee ] . was just expecting too much and was thus bound to be disappointed . based on my experience , one wonders if there is n't an element of `` '' about the reputation of this place . doubt will be patronising this establishment in the foreseeable future .

got off to a very promising start but ultimately left slightly underwhelmed . were welcomed enthusiastically and shown to our table . placed drink orders and this is where it went wrong . then took fifteen minutes for the drinks to arrive and this was only after we chased . then they came one at a time and not all together for the three of us dining together . in mind we had booked a table for noon on a so it wasn ’ t massively busy . have to say is that the food was really good . had a tuna carpaccio to start and for my main – both of which were delicious and well presented . ’ s just that the service didn ’ t match up to the food . chap on the table next to us complained about his fish – which he felt was undercooked . message back from the kitchen was that the chef had been shown this and there was nothing wrong with it ! ’ s not the point – if the was unhappy he should have been served the dish again with the fish cooked more to their liking . ’ m giving it a out of – but that ’ s an average of for the food and for the service .

husband and walked about hours ( because we are blind and walked right past ) to get to the from after reading about it online on a recent trip to , and it did not disappoint . atmosphere was very trendy and it was very busy on a night . sat in the bar area on the first floor , has a very relaxed feeling . ordered cheese trays for two to start , ordered the fish and chips , and my husband ordered a burger . was so excited to get a chance to have some traditional fare during my trip as most places do not offer gluten free options on the classics , and it has been a long time since have been able to have fish and chips at cheeses arrived , with a separate board for each of us and included four cheeses , gluten free toast , and fig compote . cheeses are all cheeses . were excellent , and the fig compote was delicious paired with them . mains took a bit longer than expected , but the wait staff took note of this and came to the table to inform us the manager was looking into the delay without us even having to ask about it . food appeared within five minutes of that and was completely worth the wait . gluten free fish was wonderful in flavour and texture , and am picky about my fish as an east coast girl . homemade tartar sauce was lovely and the chunky chips were crisp without being overcooked . only complaint would be that the fish is served on a green pea puree , which , while tasty , made the crispy batter on the fish somewhat soggy ( but maybe this is how fish and chips with mushy peas is supposed to be served ? ) . would have preferred the peas on the side . husband enjoyed the burger as well , and he also really liked the chunky , would highly recommend this place , especially if you have gluten issues . my next trip to , look forward to trying the restaurant level upstairs !

this would be a busy night leading up to a friend went early to get our name on the list at . were told we could get on the list for so we went away had a drink and came back at . were not seated until another minutes waiting at the front desk being continually told the table would be ready in minutes . we eventually sat down our waitress , , was brilliant - polite , friendly and attentive . we told her about our long additional wait she offered to speak to the manager to see what they could do , which we really appreciated and did not expect . meal itself was ok ( on a level with pizza express etc. ) . we were given the bill we were told by the manager that they could not offer us any complimentary drinks for our wait as they had checked the ( as is company policy ) and could not verify we had waited over minutes . found this process ludicrous and had definitely waited that long so queried with them . were met with defensiveness and over this issue with them for a long time , getting heated at points . after explaining that it was the lack of communication and honesty about the wait rather than the wait itself necessarily ( which apparently we should expect as we were told the table ' be ready at that time and should expect to wait a few how is a few will never know ) they eventually agreed . do n't think this is a particular fault of the staff but more ludicrous company policies that favour and saving at any cost and do not value customer loyalty and retention . can assure you this will not work in the long run - despite relying on your location . we been treated in a less defensive manner and been offered some small consolation from the beginning ( allowed by giving your staff the freedom to do so ) we could have recommended to others and most likely would have returned due to the service too , but now highly unlikely to eat here again .

went at the end of - although we 're a couple , it was not a romantic dinner deux ' , so this had no bearing on what we thought of the evening . had read a lot about the place and was looking forward to an interesting evening . other half adores food and spent a long time travelling around so knows what to expect : from high end to bargain basement . am as much at home in a top-class restaurant as am in a tea 'n ' chips style café - 's start off with the good : excellent , homely that 's where it girlfriend rang up earlier to book a table for two , and was told the restaurant was too busy to cater for us . problem , we decided to place an order online to eat at went for a section of the advertised ' and clicked through , selecting the free local delivery option . received an email confirming the order had been accepted to be delivered to our after we rang to check that they had received the order and how long the food would take to prepare and were informed a wait of approx minutes . restaurant called back shortly after this and stated that they no longer offered what we had ordered ie , the tapas sized portions of main course pasta dishes ( advertised at about half the cost of the full sized main portions ) but that as they had been advertised , they would fulfil the minutes later we noticed at the top of the menu on their website it states that food is only available for collection , not delivery ( despite this being available as an option on their online ordering system , and us receiving a confirmation email stating the food would be delivered ) . rang the restaurant to clarify and were told , they would not deliver . my girlfriend went to pick up the order the restaurant was almost empty ( at the same time we requested a table for originally ) and the waiter was , to be fair , very apologetic about the situation . girlfriend asked the who seemed to be in charge whether the food was still hot as it was now some minutes after we were told the food would be ready . perfectly reasonable thing to check given the circumstances , right ? was told that it was n't the restaurant 's problem we were so late ( ! ) by the clearly annoyed chef . she explained we had selected delivery and that it was n't our fault we did not arrive when the food was originally ready ( who knows what would have happened had we not proactively phoned to clarify the delivery situation ) she was again told they did n't offer delivery . showed the chef the confirmation email which was greeted with a word of advice to the owners of this establishment : do not offer a service that is clearly not fit for purpose in its current form , and consider providing some customer service training for your staff . no point during our interactions with the restaurant were we rude about the multiple problems resulting from you not having an up-to-date website , so the less than friendly response we got when we went to collect left a bad taste in our mouths and spoiled what would have been a most pleasant meal .

a recent trip to was so excited to see 's name on a in . am a dedicated food network fan ( living in ) so was thrilled to be able to experience one of his restaurants first hand . menu looked simple but simple yet expectations of an excellent standard was one of the attractions . a real disappointment ! it started with my rose wine glass having to be sent back - it was filthy with residue lipstick marks . selection of what we thought would be a light lunch portion - hand picked crab and on toast - turned out to be crab ( hardly ) in a watery runny mayonnaise with the crab completely overpowered by strong white onion . avocado equally was overpowered by what appeared to be lemon infused oil and lemon juice . `` '' ( envisioned a lovely thick slice of wholemeal country loaf ) turned out to be rock hard very small slices of bruschetta which left us wanting and still waitresses somewhat unenthusiastic greeting when we arrived was soon explained by the fight between staff which occured right behind our table over an apparent disagreement on loading the dishwasher , which resulted in her further her discontent to other staff ( within our earshot ) and leaving the restaurant in a huff clearly for some `` time out '' . a second glass of wine was not offered to me ( the wine was actually excellent for a warm day ) had no desire to sit there any longer given that the restaurants ambience had been completely destroyed by the disappointing food and unhappy would not return and would deter my firm foodie friends from going there . have always been a huge fan of simple but robust flavours on foodnetwork which always look mouthwatering . do hope he takes the time to review his cafe to ensure his standards in food are being delivered .

've been to a couple of times in the past year or so and it 's usually been great so decided to take some family there for dinner last week . staff are always great , got great big smiles on their faces and know what they 're talking about in regards to the food and wine . tapas style menu is great . ordered a variety of dishes to share ; squid ( perfectly cooked ) ( beautifully tender ) mussels with smoked bacon ( awesome ! ) chicken hearts ( nicely cooked with a rich sauce ) and creamed peas ( really fresh ) and these were all great . the crab on toast needed more salt and lemon juice and there was only two sardines for the six of us to share . these tapas dishes , we had the porterhouse to share which was slightly overcooked but the quality of the day aged beef still shone through . the whole turbot which was delicious . dishes left us feeling satisfied but we were persuaded by the lovely looking dessert menu . rice pudding ( fantastic ) salted caramel tart ( far too sweet and a little bit sickly , think they used filo pastry instead of sweet pastry and it just did n't have a nice texture to it ) and gooseberry ( the were n't set ! ! even close ! would have preferred the chef to tell us that they were n't ready and to order something else instead of trying to blag it and serve us a small glass of flavoured cream ) it was a lovely meal and we all left feeling happy and satisfied . service and atmosphere are always great so will probably go back in the future .

here last night with two friends . were looking for somewhere to eat before going to a show and stumbled across this place . nice inside and the staff were really pleasant and helpful . decided to have the mixed starter , any starters from the menu . butterfly prawns were delicious and the pulled pork cigars were excellent , served with a dipping sauce with a nice kick to it . calamari was outstanding though , to be honest 'm not a great lover of it , can take it or leave it but my friends like it so thought would give it another go . was n't disappointed , huge calamari rings in panto breadcrumbs , cooked to perfection . mains did not disappoint either , one of my friends had the hardcore burger , was massive , he was glad he had n't ordered fries with it as they definitely were n't needed . had the sirloin steak , cooked exactly as asked and melt in the mouth , the skin on fries that came with it were n't really needed either but we all tried a few and they were very good . other friend ordered the jumbo prawns , she was a bit concerned as it says on the menu you only get , she need n't have worried , you could n't get much more on the plate other than the prawns , they were massive ! all know size is n't everything so did she think they tasted good ? , best prawns she 's had in a very long time . bottle of prosecco to accompany a fantastic meal and pleasantly surprised at the bill , not as much as 'd thought and for the standard and quantity of food we had thought it was very reasonable . visit here but on this showing would definitely come back .
